page.title: 06Family life-changes 1945-85.
page.content: In 1945 there were no washing machines so people who did their own washing would have to do it by hand. The other alternative was to send the dirty washing to the laundry. A van would come round once a week and pick up all the washing when it would be taken to a big laundry on Melton Road, and washed. The number of people employed there was about 25. Instead of buying clothes as most people do today,people made their own. Girls made dresses and were perhaps better needlewomen than they are now. Boys would probably have had hand-me-downs from older brothers or fathers. At the end of the war most people had radios but television was only just starting.In 1945 a bus fare to{Ipswich}was 3d (1.5p) whereas now it is 75p.On the whole people had less money to spend and had to make-do-and- mend. {St. Mary's.}
